abstract: Chinese state news agency Xinhua reports sentencing of 45 people to prison for supporting terrorist organizations in Xinjiang region; report does not mention defendants are Uighurs, ethnic minority in ongoing conflict with Chinese government.
lead_paragraph: The names of the defendants indicated that they were Uighurs, a Turkic minority in the ethnically volatile region that has become increasingly estranged from the government.

headline.main: China Sentences 45 in Restive Region of Xinjiang
headline.print_headline: World Briefing | Asia; China: 45 Are Imprisoned in Xinjiang

snippet: The names of the defendants indicated that they were Uighurs, a Turkic minority in the ethnically volatile region that has become increasingly estranged from the government.
